snippet: The holiday week box office on Broadway saw 18 shows top the $1 million mark, with "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" making more in a week than any other show in history.
abstract: The holiday week box office on Broadway saw 18 shows top the $1 million mark, with "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" making more in a week than any other show in history.
lead_paragraph: Broadway producers and theater owners charged higher-than-usual prices for many seats last week to take advantage of tourists over the temperate New Year's weekend, and the resulting profits were enormous. Eighteen of Broadway's 34 shows earned more than $1 million, with "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" setting a record for the highest gross ever on Broadway -- $2,941,794 for nine performances - according to data released by producers on Tuesday afternoon.

headline.main: Broadway Box Office Soars, With 'Spider-Man' Flying Highest Ever
